intro: Petrophile wonganensis, commonly known as the Wongan heath, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is a shrub that typically grows in heathlands and sandy soils, often in areas with low rainfall. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, adapted to the dry conditions of its habitat. Petrophile wonganensis is part of the plant family Proteaceae, which is known for its diverse and often showy floral structures.
